data.title: City of New Orleans
data.text:
Tuesday, August 27

University of New Orleans (UNO) University Center

Senator Ted Hickey Ballroom (Room 203)

2000 Alumni Drive

Free parking available on-site

Resource Fair

5 p.m. to 6 p.m.

Budget Town Hall

6 p.m. to 7:30 p.m.

This meeting with be live streamed on NOLA.gov and social media platforms. It will also be recorded and posted on the City's YouTube channel and run on the Government Access Channel on Cox television for additional public access.

August 16, 2024 | From NOPD News

NOPD Announces Arrest of Suspect in Homicide Investigation

Today (August 16, 2024), the NOPD announced the arrest of Ted “Tezo” Breaux (black male, DOB: 11-02-2001) of Luling, La., in its investigation of a homicide that occurred on August 11, 2024, in the 10800 block of Chef Menteur Highway.

August 16, 2024 | From NOPD News

NOPD Announces Arrest of Suspect in Homicide Investigation

Today (August 16, 2024), the NOPD announced the arrest of Erick Garrison (black male, DOB: 03-28-1993) in its investigation of a homicide that occurred on August 3, 2024, in the 3100 block of Saint Roch Avenue.

August 16, 2024 | From NOPD News

NOPD Announces Significant Reduction in Crime Throughout City in 2024

Today (August 16, 2024), NOPD Superintendent Anne E. Kirkpatrick announced that the NOPD has seen a significant reduction in criminal incidents in the City of New Orleans to date in 2024.

August 15, 2024 | From New Orleans Fire Department

NOFD Combats Two-Alarm Fire in the Treme Neighborhood

On Thursday, August 15, 2024, at 4:37 a.m., the New Orleans Fire Department (NOFD) was dispatched to a reported dwelling fire in the city’s Treme neighborhood.

August 15, 2024 | From NOPD News

Suspect Wanted For Murder

New Orleans Police are asking the public's assistance with locating a suspect wanted for second degree murder.

August 15, 2024 | From NOPD News

Suspect Wanted For Theft

New Orleans Police are asking the public's assistance with locating a suspect wanted for theft by fraud, illegal transmission of monetary funds (four counts), and identity theft (four counts).

August 14, 2024 | From NOPD News

Suspect Wanted For Burglary

New Orleans Police are asking the public's assistance with locating a suspect wanted for residential burglary.

August 13, 2024 | From City of New Orleans

TRAFFIC ADVISORY: Lane Closure on 500 block of South Galvez Street

The City of New Orleans today announced that Department of Public Works (DPW) contractor Hard Rock Construction, LLC will be performing a lane closure on the 500 block of South Galvez Street starting Aug. 14 through Sept. 11 to accommodate the utility work as part of the Iberville, Tulane-Gravier, LGD, CBD Group A project. Local traffic will be accommodated to enter and exit the neighborhood.

August 13, 2024 | From City of New Orleans

TRAFFIC ADVISORY: Single Lane Closure on Alvar Bridge for Streetlight Repairs

The City of New Orleans today announced that starting Wednesday, Aug. 14, at approximately 7 a.m., the Department of Public Works (DPW) will close the left travel lane in the southbound direction on the Alvar Bridge. This closure is part of ongoing streetlight repairs managed by DPW.

August 13, 2024 | From NOPD News

NOPD Identifies Suspect in Theft of Cremated Remains & Bicycle

The NOPD has identified a suspect in the theft of cremated remains and a bicycle from the 3700 block of Dauphine Street on July 18, 2024.

Mayor LaToya Cantrell

On May 7, 2018, LaToya Cantrell made history as New Orleans’ first woman mayor in its 300-year history. After that historic victory, Mayor Cantrell was inaugurated to a second term on January 10, 2022. Her passion for the City of Yes and her dedication to its residents remains stronger than ever.

Mayor Cantrell remains focused on the issues of public safety, infrastructure, affordable housing and improving the quality of life for all New Orleans residents.
